experience: You and Chris both know Xavier Musy, Jamie Vaccaro Harris, and 12 others
You both worked at Swiftpage from Mar 2017 to Sep 2017
Day one at Gartner Symposium - showing some very cool stuff once our BIG booth goes live tomorrow! #Gartner
Washington, Tyne and Wear, United Kingdom
Global lead for net new demand generation and install base marketing for Swiftpage.
Accountable for the marketing function of Act! Customer Relationship Management outside of the Americas and Australasia.

Recruited post acquisition of two global Customer Relationship Management software products; Saleslogix and Act!. Tasked to build the international marketing team and operations responsible for the marketing functions outside of the Americas. Recruited and led a team of international marketers to build marketing systems, processes and campaigns to deliver customer acquisition programmes. Implemented an intensive programme of brand awareness following a brand refresh and launched multiple new online marketing programmes in three languages resulting in new business leads growth of 400% year on year.Established nurture programmes and implemented marketing automation systems to support sales conversion and returned product lines to double digit revenue growth.Supported the transition of Saleslogix to Infor post acquisition in 2014, prior to the rebrand of the product to Infor CRM.
Act! is the #1 best-selling Customer & Contact Manager
Act! is the #1 best-selling Customer & Contact Manager

Invited to join a small specialist strategy team following a restructure to a pan European Enterprise software division across eight European locations.Part of the core team assembled to define and identify the key drivers and strategy for the Mid Market Europe Enterprise.Undertook market analysis for the Human Resource Management sector and identified growth areas and made recommendation through investment cases and risk analysis in future investment and diversification into sub markets including Human Capital management. Managed analyst relationships with IDC and Gartner. Approached to lead the International marketing function for Swiftpage following acquisition of Saleslogix (Infor CRM) and Act! Contact Management.
Newcastle Upon Tyne/ and Winnersh Berkshire

Responsible for the short - medium term development and implementation of business strategy for global CRM solutions, Sage Saleslogix, Sage CRM in the United Kingdom and European Act! Business Partner Channel.Instigated a pilot, contract and billing programme for a move from perpetual licensing to annual subscription based contracts. Transitioned the Customer Relationship Management products in the United Kingdom to a recurring revenue model several years before the wider adoption to core business strategy.Part of the evolution and development of the financial forecasting process for a FTSE 100 company. Worked closely with stakeholder across the business to establish domain expert input and accountability to key metrics and financial forecasting.Part of cross business strategy team to undertake market and competitive research and analysis, strategy formulation, goal setting and reporting and milestone setting.Recruited into a specialist strategy team following the restructure of the enterprise software division.

Accountable for the lead generation campaign for the UK Mid-Market Enterprise portfolio through a channel sales model. Responsible for the initial launch of the flagship Sage 200 product suite campaigns in the United Kingdom.

Internally recruited to role to focus on post sale and service marketing to generate incremental revenue streams through upsell and cross sell programmes.Established cyclical educational service campaign to customers prior to service or MOT to inform of benefits to brake fluid change and timing belt change. Generated £500,000+ of recurring incremental revenue through parts and labour sales per annum.Launched marketing programme to establish tyre sale business across 27 retail sites in the UK.
Managed 60+ print and online advertisements per week co-managing a £1m+ advertising spend.

recommendations: I thoroughly enjoyed working with Ian for almost 4 years at Swiftpage. Ian is a very different thinker, always creating, consistently bringing an alternative view to a project, and raises reflections that more often than not, had yet to be considered. His digital media design has helped bring our online collateral, awareness campaigns and social media feeds to life. He adds a new dimension to team discussions that changes the dynamic, and provokes further creative debate. He’s also a very nice guy, selfless, interesting and thoughtful.

Digital Marketing Manager at Certent, Inc.

LeeAnne and I work together at Swiftpage, where LeeAnne is our Digital Marketing Manager and I am Senior Director of Marketing.  I thoroughly enjoy working with LeeAnne. She’s enthusiastic, effective, and eager to initiate new projects. LeeAnne is responsible for a multimillion dollar global online marketing budget, used to drive awareness and lead generation through branded and non-branded search and display campaigns. In the 12 months I have managed her, she has undertaken channel split testing and optimized our channel selection which has resulted in increased web traffic, the doubling of our paid search conversions and new customer adds.LeeAnne has worked closely with external comparison sites, affecting our online reputation to ensure the reviews we receive better reflect our Net Promoter Score. She has worked as co-lead to establish our keyword content strategy, has been a core member in establishing our blog and worked closely to improve the technical optimization of our website.LeeAnne has delivered both tactical and strategic projects, helping us grow our customer base by substantially improving our new business acquisition and delivering SEO projects that will benefit the organisation long into the future.

October 3, 2016, Chris was a client of Mike’s

I’ve worked with Mike for several years and he’s first to mind for any corporate photography. Mike is professional, plain speaking and reliable. He can be discreet and can blend in with delegates at larger conferences, or switch to create a fun and relaxed environment when taking portraits.  We recently used Mike for brochure portrait shots prior to our European Conference.  He put his subjects at ease, made an ordinary office environment eye catching, and managed to use the available light to turn a dull winter morning into what appeared, in the final shots, to be a bright sunny day. Most importantly he’s very handy with the Photoshop. Crows feet, bags under the eyes and grey hairs removed on request.  Highly recommended and good graphic designer to boot.

November 3, 2015, Chris was senior to Simon but didn’t manage directly

I hope to work with Simon again, and would not hesitate to recruit or recommend him in a commercial product marketing role. I worked closely with Simon for three years at Swiftpage as he progressed into several product and commercial roles. Simon is effective, measured and logical. He has a commercial mind-set, combined with technical knowledge and an output driven focus that resulted in the delivery of effective projects that progressed our business and made us more competitive.Whilst I headed up the marketing operations function, Simon seamlessly transitioned into several product and commercial roles to fit the businesses evolving needs. Each role retained close ties with the marketing operations team, who relied and valued Simon as a standout performer.  He is a careful listener and a quick learner. He is a concise communicator, has a calm head and dry wit and builds strong relationships with colleagues and channel partners. He can turn theory and considered planning into action and results. After working with Simon for several weeks, I found myself paying careful attention to each of his views and opinions. Whilst often conveyed in a relaxed style, they are always insightful, considered, measured and prove to hold their weight.I enjoyed working with Simon because he was a first-rate professional, a big hitter.

Marketing Manager for Cloud Solutions at Sage

Sarah reported into me as part of an International marketing team from February 2015 to October 2015. In that time, I've seen her not only shine at the core elements of her job – like event planning, marketing automation and copy editing -- but also learn other tasks that extend beyond the scope of her role, like campaign management, content planning, contractor management, and leading delivering our guest blogging efforts aligning to our SEO strategy.Sarah took the lead on coordinating an International conference for approximately 100 resellers and project managed all departments, costs, location, training, and audio visual requirements to create a solid foundation for an important event.  Sarah was professional, friendly, and was always smiling which had a very positive effect upon the office. She was a very popular member of staff and built strong relationships across all departments.The work Sarah has undertaken on blogging, and back linking will benefit Swiftpage into the future. I will miss working with her and have optimistic predictions for her future career.
